subject: College Athletics
Bowl Games
lead_paragraph: The Atlantic Coast Conference will send its ninth bowl pick to face the top selection from the Mid-American Conference in the GMAC Bowl next season. The agreement was reached after the A.C.C.’s contract expired with the Humanitarian Bowl in Boise, Idaho. The A.C.C. will take the place of Conference USA, which had sent a team to the GMAC Bowl in each of its 10 years. Jerry Silverstein, the GMAC Bowl president, said that if fewer than nine A.C.C. teams were bowl eligible, the game would pick a team from another conference for the Jan. 6 game in Mobile, Ala.
